name: Centara Grand & Bangkok Convention Centre at CentralWorld

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First stop Bangkok on way to Sydney - could not fault the reception we received lovely staff who could not do enough for us. Food in hotel was nice our room was perfect with best views over the city. Very comfortable bed and great bathroom. The position was central although traffic does not allow you to move easily so much congestion we used the tuk tuk which caused great amusement not to mention some fear ! The sky bar was wonderful early evening to watch sun go down located on 56th floor. Would stay again
reviews.title: room with a view
Great location
reviews.text: This is one hotel that avid shoppers should consider because of its excellent location.
Right in the most pulsating area of Bangkok, this hotel is huge and grand. Reception is relatively fast and you will be welcomed to a lovely room with a fantastic view.
reviews.title: On top of the world

reviews.text: I really love the state-of-the-art bathroom because it is so spacious, and you can actually watch the tv while soaking in the bathtub.
reviews.title: Good but not the best

reviews.text: Room is warmly-lit and highly comfortable.
reviews.title: Age doesn't matter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and always stayed in the same hotel, for a simple reason, it does feel like home,its center to everything , access to the sky train and other transport is very convenient. Staff are always very friendly and helpful. Beautiful view from our room. Excellent choice for breakfast.
reviews.title: My favorite Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in centre of Bangkok attached to a very large Mall Decor good large bathroom nice and clean . Very impersonal and meals very expensive for buffets in the evening not good quality either more of a business hotel .Breakfast bunfight not very good either . We have stayed near the river before and regret making change
reviews.title: first class hotel

reviews.text: Stayed there 3 nights in December 2012.
reviews.title: Room with a view

reviews.text: Room has a good view on a high floor. Decor was nice with big and modern bathroom. The elevator was slow and crowded at times.
reviews.title: nice Hotel

reviews.text: Location is excellent at the Central World Shopping Mall. Many restaurants and a good supermarket in the mall.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Stayed a week on a high floor, which allows access to the lounge on the 51st floor, which serves free food and drinks (during happy hour). The lounge also allows you to get away from the hussle of it all. Hotel has a very nice pool on the 26th floor and is within walking distance to the Jim Thompson house. The hotel is attached to a very nice mall. (There is however not much of a point in travelling so far for a mall, that can be visited at home too). During conference times the elevators can be very slow and very croweded in the morning and evening hours. All staff very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Very comfy stay

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights as a part of a business conference. The hotel appears quite modern however upon closer inspection of the rooms it is starting to feel a little dated. I had the opportunity to be upgraded to a room on one of the executive floors (Floor 49) and had a very nice room that looked down over the pool and some nearby temples. The room was large and well equipped. The room met all my basic needs (comfortable bed, block out curtains, good aircon and hot shower). In fact the bathroom is quite large and I had a bath and a very large shower. The gym is quite large and well equipped with staff on hand to assist if needed. I ate breakfasts and lunches at the main restuarant on the 24th floor and whilst always busy, the selection was very good. My only gripe would be the elevators. There are only 4 lifts servicing what is a very large hotel. On ocassions expect a little extra dwell time whilst you wait for a lift. Oh and a last point if you are in Bangkok to shop well you have been dropped in the middle of shoppers paradise.
reviews.title: Great for shopping

reviews.text: Absolutely spotless, huge rooms, friendly staff. The pool was large, relaxing and had sun all day long, the pool bar was in the shade and service was excellent.
reviews.title: Ideal location

reviews.text: Located over the Central World Mall and next door to the Siam Mall it is a shopping paradise, close to the sky-train which will take you anywhere in Bangkok, the 55floor open air restaurant and lounge has a magnificent view of the city and should not be missed.
reviews.title: Sunny days in BKK

reviews.text: All the staff are efficient and go out of their way to help, overall a wonderful experience
reviews.title: Ideal for shoppers!

reviews.text: Overall a top hotel. Excellent service and quality. Rooms are nice, comfy and clean.
reviews.title: Quality in almost all aspects!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only setback for this gem is the terrible waiting for the lifts. This hotel prides itself with a 23rd floor lobby and a wonderful bar/restaurant on the top floor, but the lifts are the spoiling factor. Long waiting times just doesn't go well.
reviews.title: Awesome location, great rooms & affordable
